title.native: 異世界はスマートフォンとともに。2
title.romaji: Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni. 2
title.english: In Another World With My Smartphone 2

description:
The second season of Isekai wa Smartphone to Tomo ni.

Touya Mochizuki grows accustomed to his new life in another world. Armed with his trusty smartphone, the teenager accepts small quests at his leisure while spending time with his new fiancées: Yumina Urnea Belfast, Yae Kokonoe, and twin sisters Linse and Elze Shileska. But even in a relaxing environment, Touya is only beginning to understand the responsibilities that come with these engagements.

In addition to his romantic woes, the elder fairy Lean wishes to locate the remaining pieces of Babylon, the floating island that the mysterious Professor Regina Babylon created five thousand years ago. Touya reluctantly accepts her request and seeks out the teleportation circles that will lead to the islands. However, strange monsters have emerged—possibly powerful enough to destroy the world. In order to save the second life he was given, Touya must weaponize ancient technologies to fight these monsters—all while balancing his overwhelming number of relationships.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: 帶著智慧型手機闖蕩異世界。2

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Kingdom Management
tags.description: Characters in these series take on the responsibility of running a town or kingdom, whether they take control of an existing one, or build their own from the ground up.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Polyamorous
tags.description: Features a character who is in a consenting relationship with multiple people at one time.

node.description:
__Date of Birth:__ 1976
__Place of Birth:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Doujin Circle:__ DO-RAKU7  

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/usatsukaeiji)

**Eiji Usatsuka** is a Japanese light novel illustrator. He is notable for the illustration for the series Zero no Tsukaima. He illustrates insert images for many novels.   

After university graduation he was employed as illustrator by the visual novel publisher Visual Art's using the pseudonym Sawagani (サワガニ, Japanese Freshwater Crab). As side job he made illustrations for light novels which is against the company policy. The similarity of "both peoples" designs, were however noticed and later revealed by Tōya Okano (scenario assistant for Visual Art's' Clannad) in a Dengeki G's Magazine interview article presenting Visual Art's brand Mana's game Angel Magister.  

 (Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.
**Honami Yamagishi** is a Japanese editor, who provides editing assistance to various works.
_Note: Not to be confused with [山田公平](https://anilist.co/staff/235048/Kouhei-Yamada)._
**Pei Ming Zhou** is an animator affiliated with Hayi.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/増田敏彦)

Affiliated with [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/).
